channel.title: Indie Game Development
channel.description: How many of you are seriously interested in sitting down and working on a 6 - 8 month project from scratch and creating an indie game? I've been programming a game from Java for about a month now and I'd love to know if there's anyone willing to help draw up pixel art, do level design, story-writing, etc. If not, maybe at least share your experiences and some good do's and don'ts for indie games? Share your thoughts and pics!

item.title: Indie Game Development
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Sure, just make sure you post anything related to your game here. Also, creating a game engine is a lot of work.

Read full topic

item.title: Indie Game Development
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

well then good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Indie Game Development
item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

Docent:

2D? Until you try making a game from scratch, it seems easy, I tried, I almost got clipped walking to work, that was about it. I’d suggest using a game engine because it’s way too much work to make a game from scratch.

Tree:

Use a game engine and save yourself a lot of headaches.

I already have programmed the engine my friends. The engine is already done lol. It’s a lot less stressful than you may think. I have it to where the user can walk around, shoot projectiles, and talk to NPCs. I can show screenshots if you’re interested. I was really just looking for people interested in helping an already started project.

Read full topic
